docs.snippet: Doping corruption at the highest reaches of the Russian sports world is testing the resolve of the regulatory bodies to enforce the rules....
docs.lead_paragraph: Doping corruption at the highest reaches of the Russian sports world is testing the resolve of the regulatory bodies to enforce the rules.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column underscores degree to which regulatory bodies of international sport have been asleep at wheel with respect to Russian doping scandal; questions whether bodies like World Anti-Doping Agency and International Assn of Athletics Federations will muster courage to deliver punishment Russia deserves and ban its athletes from Olympic Games.

headline.main: In Russian Doping Scandal, Time for a Punishment to Fit the Crime
headline.print_headline: Punishment to Fit the Doping Crime

docs.snippet: The highest compliment America will pay black people — whether O. J. Simpson, Muhammad Ali or Prince — is to claim they escaped their own blackness....
docs.lead_paragraph: The highest compliment America will pay black people — whether O. J. Simpson, Muhammad Ali or Prince — is to claim they escaped their own blackness.

docs.snippet: After two days of meetings with top European officials and international executives, Russian President Vladimir Putin sounded reconciliatory in a round-table with international media Friday, saying Russia is ready to work with whoever is elected t...
docs.lead_paragraph: After two days of meetings with top European officials and international executives, Russian President Vladimir Putin sounded reconciliatory in a round-table with international media Friday, saying Russia is ready to work with whoever is elected the new U.S. president and offering only a mild condemnation of the IAAF's decision to ban Russian track and field athletes from competing in the upcoming Olympics.

headline.main: Putin Says Russia Will Work With Any US President
headline.print_headline: Putin Says Russia Will Work With Any US President

docs.snippet: Penalizing a country for doping seems to be a much more effective way to ensure rapid and enduring change....
docs.lead_paragraph: Penalizing a country for doping seems to be a much more effective way to ensure rapid and enduring change.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Olympics column says that barring Russia's track and field team as whole from 2016 Olympics for widespread doping should bring swift change.

headline.main: Barring Russia’s Team, Not Just Individuals, Is a Powerful Move
headline.print_headline: Watchdogs Show Teeth and, Finally, Some Spine
